Class PoolTable

java.lang.Object
PoolTable
public class PoolTable
extends java.lang.Object

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    PoolTable()
    Constructor for a pool table, incorporates all the balls of such table, all of the tables components, amongst others.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void aimLine()
    aimLine method allows the user to aim down the line whilst playing, allowing less cluttered code in the playPool method
    void allOfColourPut​(java.lang.String colour)
    allOfColour method allows the users to check if all the balls of such a colour are put or not this allows us to check if a certain player is on his last ball or not, changing the permissions such that contacting the black ball as a first hit is allowed and also such that putting said ball is allowed.
    void ballInHand()
    The ballInHand method allows the user to place the ball anywhere in the first quarter of the tables, starting in the left hand side, which is useful for when a foul occurs and the ball is in hand of the player who plays next
    void detectFouls()
    The detectFouls method allows the game to detect fouls based on the playerturn1 variable, it changes parameters such as foul, which registers a foul, playAgain which indicates the current player should play again due to having scored a point, and gameOver, which indicates the game has ended, i.e the black ball has been put and there is a winner.
    void inBounds​(PoolBall ball)
    inBounds is a method which makes sure the ball remains inside the carpet of the pool table by altering the ortogonal x and y variables of a ball
    void playPool()
    Play pool function incorporates all the aspets of the pool game, such as changing te score, balls being put in sockets, re-spawning the white ball after it goes in a socket, amongst many more.
    void putBalls​(PoolBall ball)
    Allows the game to check when a ball has been or not put, and checking the colour of the ball put to register which has been put and altering variables such as whiteIsPut and blackIsPut, which are useful to check for the end of the game or fouls.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • PoolTable

      public PoolTable()
      Constructor for a pool table, incorporates all the balls of such table, all of the tables components, amongst others.

  • Method Details

    • aimLine

      public void aimLine()
      aimLine method allows the user to aim down the line whilst playing, allowing less cluttered code in the playPool method

    • playPool

      public void playPool()
      Play pool function incorporates all the aspets of the pool game, such as changing te score, balls being put in sockets, re-spawning the white ball after it goes in a socket, amongst many more.

    • detectFouls

      public void detectFouls()
      The detectFouls method allows the game to detect fouls based on the playerturn1 variable, it changes parameters such as foul, which registers a foul, playAgain which indicates the current player should play again due to having scored a point, and gameOver, which indicates the game has ended, i.e the black ball has been put and there is a winner.

    • ballInHand

      public void ballInHand()
      The ballInHand method allows the user to place the ball anywhere in the first quarter of the tables, starting in the left hand side, which is useful for when a foul occurs and the ball is in hand of the player who plays next

    • inBounds

      public void inBounds​(PoolBall ball)
      inBounds is a method which makes sure the ball remains inside the carpet of the pool table by altering the ortogonal x and y variables of a ball
      Parameters:
      ball -

    • putBalls

      public void putBalls​(PoolBall ball)
      Allows the game to check when a ball has been or not put, and checking the colour of the ball put to register which has been put and altering variables such as whiteIsPut and blackIsPut, which are useful to check for the end of the game or fouls.
      Parameters:
      ball -

    • allOfColourPut

      public void allOfColourPut​(java.lang.String colour)
      allOfColour method allows the users to check if all the balls of such a colour are put or not this allows us to check if a certain player is on his last ball or not, changing the permissions such that contacting the black ball as a first hit is allowed and also such that putting said ball is allowed.
      Parameters:
      colour -
